message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.MA, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

The paper deals with the representation and reasoning about actions in multi-agent domains, which is a core topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also introduces a new action language, which involves formal logic and semantics, making it relevant to the category of logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper specifically focuses on multi-agent domains, which suggests that it falls under the category of multi-agent systems (cs.MA). The paper also deals with the specification of agents' dynamic awareness of action occurrences, which involves planning and decision-making, making it relevant to the category of programming languages (cs.PL). Finally, the paper discusses the practical implementability of the proposed action language, which is relevant to the category of software engineering (cs.SE).
